page.title: 05THE PARISH CHURCH, AMBLECOTE
page.content: Just off the busy High Street in two acres of grounds can be found the {Holy Trinity Church of Amblecote, surrounded by iron railings that somehow survived the second world war. Before the building of this church, the local parish church was{St.Mary's {Oldswinford.}From Brettell Lane this was almost a two mile walk. Due to the population increase in{Amblecote}as a result of the developing industries of glass and steel, the need for the area's own parish church grew. Built in 1842 from locally produced clay bricks, the exterior remains the same today as then, with clocktower, eight bells and Lych Gate dating back to 1921. The interior has features showing work of craftsmen in wood and stained glass. Pews were removed in 1900, chairs and choir stalls being put in.
